title: Air Force Avionics Maintenance Backshop â€” Mission Readiness

envelopes.name: Aircraft Avionics Readiness
assumptions: Diagnostic systems use ML-based fault detection on Line Replaceable Unit (LRU) test data.
Maintenance decisions prioritize mission-critical aircraft (Code 1 status).
Repair turnaround time targets: 72 hours for critical systems, 120 hours for non-critical.
constraints: Never release LRU without passing all Technical Order (TO) test procedures
All repairs must maintain component traceability per AFI 21-101
Safety-critical components require dual verification before installation

envelopes.name: Parts Supply Chain & Logistics
assumptions: Parts forecasting models predict demand based on Mean Time Between Failure (MTBF) data.
Critical parts (MICAP items) prioritized for expedited shipping.
Inventory optimization balances stock levels with budget constraints.
constraints: MICAP (Mission Capable) parts require commander approval for emergency procurement
Shelf-life items tracked and cycled per manufacturer specifications
No cannibalization without Maintenance Operations Center (MOC) authorization

envelopes.name: Safety & Technical Compliance
assumptions: Safety monitoring systems detect Technical Order (TO) deviations in real-time.
Quality assurance (QA) inspections sample 15% of completed repairs.
Safety reports escalate to Wing Safety Office for critical findings.
constraints: Any electrostatic discharge (ESD) event requires immediate investigation
Foreign Object Debris (FOD) violations halt all work until cleared
Time Compliance Technical Orders (TCTOs) override routine maintenance schedules

envelopes.name: Maintenance Scheduling & Workflow
assumptions: Scheduling AI optimizes technician assignments based on skill level and certification.
Workload balancing considers both backshop capacity and flight line demands.
Priority adjustments based on Aircraft Generation (ACG) surge requirements.
constraints: Technicians limited to 60-hour workweek per labor agreements
Minimum 2 certified technicians required for avionics bay access
Weekend maintenance requires Maintenance Operations Officer (MOO) approval

envelopes.name: Technical Training & Readiness
assumptions: Training models track skill progression for 5-level and 7-level technicians.
Certification renewals scheduled based on expiration dates and mission tempo.
Upgrade training integrated with operational work for hands-on experience.
constraints: New technicians require minimum 40 hours supervised work before solo tasks
Critical system certifications expire after 12 months without refresher
Training cannot exceed 20% of available man-hours per month

envelopes.name: Parts Supply Chain & Logistics
assumptions: Parts forecasting models predict demand based on Mean Time Between Failure (MTBF) data.

agents.name: AvionicsDiagnostic
agents.role: fault detection and LRU test analysis

agents.name: InventoryForecaster
agents.role: parts demand prediction and stock optimization

agents.name: BXDeliveryOptimizer
agents.role: BX run scheduling during duty hours

events.label: Envelope promoted
events.detail: Avionics readiness envelope (REV-AF-001-B) activated with updated F-16 radar diagnostic algorithms.

events.label: Envelope promoted
events.detail: Supply chain envelope activated with predictive inventory for deployment cycle.

events.label: Radar LRU repair prioritized
events.detail: AvionicsDiagnostic identified failed APG-68 radar transmitter on tail 89-2137 (Code 1 aircraft). Fault: power supply module. Prioritized for immediate repair. ETA: 48 hours.

events.label: MICAP parts expedited
events.detail: MICAPResolver identified 3 aircraft awaiting radar power supplies (NSN 5895-01-234-5678). Initiated emergency procurement from DLA. Projected delivery: 72 hours via AMC airlift.

events.label: Envelope promoted
events.detail: Scheduling envelope (REV-AF-004-B) activated with surge capacity planning for Red Flag exercise.

events.label: Technician workload exceeded
events.detail: ShiftOptimizer flagged 4 technicians approaching 58-hour workweek limit. Projected to exceed 60-hour constraint by Friday. Recommends cross-training support from adjacent shops.

events.label: Cross-shop support approved
events.detail: MOO approved 3 comm/nav technicians to support avionics backshop. Assignments: IFF testing, cable harness inspection. Maintains labor compliance.

events.label: Envelope promoted
events.detail: Training readiness envelope activated for quarterly certification review and 5-level upgrade planning.

events.label: Component released for installation
events.detail: RepairPrioritizer cleared APG-68 radar transmitter after successful bench test. All TO procedures passed. Dual verification complete. Released to flight line maintenance.

events.label: ESD event detected
events.detail: ESDMonitor detected electrostatic discharge during INS/GPS unit handling. Wrist strap failure on workbench #7. Component quarantined. All work halted pending investigation.

events.label: ESD investigation findings
events.detail: QAInspector investigation: wrist strap mat failure (12-month replacement overdue). Affected INS/GPS unit (S/N 9824) sent to depot for evaluation. Work area cleared for operations.

events.label: ESD equipment policy updated
events.detail: Safety Steward revised ESD prevention procedures: monthly wrist strap testing (down from quarterly), digital log tracking, automated expiration alerts.
events.reason: Prevent recurrence of ESD events due to expired equipment. Aligns with AFI 21-123 best practices.

events.label: Shelf-life parts expiring
events.detail: ShelfLifeMonitor flagged 8 radar magnetron tubes approaching 6-month shelf life. Value: $124K. Current mission demand: low. Recommends installation on training aircraft or return to depot.

events.label: Red Flag surge activated
events.detail: PriorityAdjuster recalculated priorities for exercise surge: 18 aircraft Code 1 requirement (up from 12). Extended shifts authorized: 12-hour days, 6 days/week for 3 weeks.

events.label: 5-level upgrade recommended
events.detail: SkillProgressionTracker assessed A1C Martinez: 280 hours OJT, 15 tasks completed, 92% proficiency. Recommends upgrade to 5-level (journeyman) with radar systems specialty.

events.label: Certification expirations flagged
events.detail: CertificationScheduler identified 6 technicians with radar certifications expiring in 30 days. Current ops tempo limits training availability. Requires expedited refresher scheduling.

events.label: Accelerated refresher training approved
events.detail: Training Steward coordinated weekend refresher sessions with depot instructors via VTC. All 6 technicians scheduled. Maintains certification compliance during surge operations.

events.label: DSG: Diagnostic model review
events.detail: Maintenance Stewardship Group reviewed 6-week diagnostic accuracy. AvionicsDiagnostic fault detection: 94% (target: 90%). Identified 2 false-positive patterns in FLIR systems.

events.label: FLIR diagnostic parameters updated
events.detail: Maintenance Steward refined FLIR sensor diagnostic thresholds. Reduces false positives by 35% while maintaining 92% fault detection rate.
events.reason: Field data shows FLIR temperature variance within normal operating range being flagged as faults.

events.label: Weekly readiness metrics
events.detail: Aircraft availability: 87% (up from 82%). Avg repair time: 54 hours (target: 72). MICAP impact: 2 aircraft (down from 5). Mission capability rate: 91%.

events.label: Pre-deployment stock increased
events.detail: InventoryForecaster projected deployment surge demand: +40% radar components, +25% EW modules. Recommended stock levels adjusted. Budget approved by squadron commander.

events.label: TCTO deadline approaching
events.detail: TOComplianceChecker flagged Time Compliance Technical Order 1F-16C-606: cockpit display software upgrade. 22 aircraft remaining, 45 days to deadline. Current completion rate: insufficient.

events.label: TCTO surge work scheduled
events.detail: WorkloadBalancer allocated 8 technicians for TCTO completion: 2 aircraft/day throughput. Projects 100% completion by day 251 (19 days ahead of deadline).

events.label: DSG: Safety & compliance quarterly review
events.detail: Safety Stewardship Group reviewed 12-week period. Zero Class A mishaps. ESD prevention: 100% compliant post-revision. QA pass rate: 96.5%. Identified need for FOD training refresh.

events.label: Monthly operations summary
events.detail: Red Flag surge completed successfully. 18 Code 1 aircraft maintained throughout exercise. Technician overtime: 18% (within policy). Zero labor violations. Mission success rate: 96%.
